Package sample.JavaFX.MapScene

Class MapSceneController

java.lang.Object
sample.JavaFX.MapScene.MapSceneController
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.lynden.gmapsfx.MapComponentInitializedListener, javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MapSceneController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, com.lynden.gmapsfx.MapComponentInitializedListener
MapSceneController controls the mapScene.
Implements Initializable and MapComponentInitializedListener.
the @FXML tells the compiler that this variable is connected to an FXML-file

  • Constructor Details

    • MapSceneController

      public MapSceneController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL location, java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
      In the initialize-method the images are first fetched from the database and the image-ArrayList is filled.
      A GoogleMapView object is created with the given API-key and adds the MapInitializer.
      After this the GoogleMapView is added to the mapAnchorPane and it attaches to the sides so it is stretchable.
      The search textfield is then moved to the front and is bound to the StringProperty-variable.
      Lastly the custom window menu buttons are loaded.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - the URL used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known
      resources - the ResourceBundle used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized

    • fetchImagesFromDB

      private void fetchImagesFromDB()
      Simple method for retrieving the images from the database and filling them into the ArrayList with images.

    • mapInitialized

      public void mapInitialized()
      Initializes the GeocodingService object and creates a MapOptions variable that is edited after our needs and then used to create a map with the createMap(MapOptions mapOptions) method.
      The placeImagesOnMap is then used
      Specified by:
      mapInitialized in interface com.lynden.gmapsfx.MapComponentInitializedListener

    • placeImagesOnMap

      private void placeImagesOnMap()
      A method that goes through all images and checks if the geolocation is there or not
      If the geolocation exists a marker with the geolocation is added to the map using the addMarker-method

    • addMarkerClickHandler

      private void addMarkerClickHandler​(com.lynden.gmapsfx.javascript.object.Marker marker, ImageV2 imageV2)
      This method creates a listener to the marker where it first checks if any other images is being previewed, if so, all the children of the StackPane are cleared before adding the new ImagePreviewDialog
      After this an image preview dialog with the marker/image is created
      Parameters:
      marker - the marker that is clicked
      imageV2 - the image that will be previewed

    • createImagePreviewDialog

      private void createImagePreviewDialog​(ImageV2 imageV2)
      Uses the JFoenix library that has custom dialogs and more. First create a layout and some JFX-buttons. Then creates the dialog and use the layout we just made. After that we add some EventHandlers on the button. Tells the dialog to close if user click close, while if the user press "Add to album" button the handleAddToAlbumButtonPressed-method is used.
      Parameters:
      imageV2 - the image that will be previewed

    • createPreviewImage

      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView createPreviewImage​(ImageV2 imageV2)
      Method for creating a preview image that is shown in the preview image dialog.
      Parameters:
      imageV2 - the image to be converted to the ImageView
      Returns:
      the ImageView created

    • handleAddToAlbumButtonPressed

      private void handleAddToAlbumButtonPressed​(ImageV2 imageV2)
      Opens a dialog where the user can select album to add the image to.
      Parameters:
      imageV2 - the image that is added

    • createMarker

      public com.lynden.gmapsfx.javascript.object.Marker createMarker​(double lat, double lng)
      Adds a marker to the map
      Parameters:
      lat - the latitude as a double
      lng - the longitude as a double
      Returns:
      a Marker with given longitude and latitude

    • handleBackButtonClicked

      public void handleBackButtonClicked()
      A method for handling the BackButton.
      Sends you back to MainScene.

    • addressTextFieldAction

      public void addressTextFieldAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method for handling the text input in the address textfield.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent
